description: From Latin sōlicitus, sollicitus (“thoroughly disturbed, anxious”), from sollus (“whole, entire”) + cieō (“move, disturb”). Surface analysis solicit +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: solicitous (comparative more solicitous, superlative most solicitous)

entries.meaning: Disposed to solicit; eager to obtain something desirable, or to avoid anything evil.

definitionGroups.group: (Usually followed by about, for, etc., or a clause) Showing care, concern, or attention, in any of several ways; thus:

entries.meaning: In a conscientious way, often with kindness.
examples: solicitous inquiries, asking after her husband and children

entries.meaning: In an anxious or distressed way.
